vocabulary.definition: To perceive with the eyes; to observe.

examples.tausug: Kita ku ikaw ha iskul kagabii.
examples.english: I saw you at school yesterday.

vocabulary.notes: Different meaning from the pronoun 'kita' (we inclusive).

vocabulary.definition: To move at a speed faster than a walk.

examples.tausug: Magdagan siya bang mangadjat in ulan.
examples.english: He runs when the rain starts.

vocabulary.definition: To change position or go from one place to another.
To rest in a state of reduced consciousness.

examples.tausug: Tug na kamo pasalan biyhyaun malawum dum na.
examples.english: Go to sleep because now it is late night.

vocabulary.definition: To put food into the mouth and chew and swallow it.
vocabulary.notes: Same spelling as the noun 'kaun' (food/meal) but different function.

vocabulary.definition: To take liquid into the mouth and swallow.

examples.tausug: Inum kamo tubig bang kamo mauhaw.
examples.english: Drink water when you are thirsty.

vocabulary.definition: To look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter.

examples.tausug: Bassa kamo sin kitab kahaba' adlaw.

vocabulary.definition: To mark letters, words, or other symbols on a surface.

examples.tausug: Sulat kaw sin ngan mo ha katas.
examples.english: Write your name on the paper.

vocabulary.definition: To move from one place to another on foot.
To get on or into a vehicle for transportation.

examples.tausug: Sakat kamo sin kappal pa Jolo.

vocabulary.definition: To carry or transport something to a destination.

examples.tausug: Hatud kaw  hadiya pa bagay mo.
examples.english: Bring a gift to your friend.

vocabulary.definition: To make it easier for someone to do something.

examples.tausug: Tabangi aku magbuhat sin sagappak ini.
examples.english: Help me me carry this chubby person.

vocabulary.definition: To comprehend or grasp the meaning of something.

examples.tausug: Sabuta na siya ampa way problema'.
examples.english: Understand him/her so there would be no problem.

vocabulary.definition: To stay or wait in place until something happens.
To be in an upright position on one's feet.

examples.tausug: Tindug kaw bang dumatung in nakura'.
examples.english: Stand up when our leader comes.

vocabulary.definition: To rest one's weight on one's buttocks.
Past tense form of kaun (to eat), indicating completed action.
vocabulary.notes: The prefix 'nag-' indicates past tense for many verbs.

vocabulary.definition: Future tense form of kaun (to eat), indicating action yet to happen.
vocabulary.notes: The prefix 'mag-' indicates future tense or habitual ,routine action or general for many verbs.
